column2: You watch as the dancing flames rise towards the sky.
It looks like spring shall come this year.
The Varangian Guard is formed.
The craftsmen start the process of carving and painting the runestone.
You will raise a runestone in honor of your own person.
You have the chest buried and vow never to speak a word of it to another soul.
You allow the preacher to continue his missionary work.
You banish the preacher from your lands.
You and your closest family convert to the new faith, and a new religious advisor appears at your court.
You throw the preacher into your dungeons.
You begin preparations for the blot.\n
You begin preparations for the Jarilo festival.\n
Preparations for the Great Hunt begin.\n
You begin preparations for the Ukon juhla festival.\n
You begin preparations for the Užgavenes festival.\n
You keep the bear as a pet.
You hurry to the chest...
You make your way to the area where the forces involved in the hunt are assembling.
The assembled forces begin the encirclement.
You refrain from issuing the challenge.
You will no longer be able to commission runestones.
You issue clear instructions not to permit the witch within a stone's throw of your longhouse.
The deliberations begin.
The Jomsvikings are founded.
You keep the animal chained for your amusement.
You ready your bow and move in towards the trapped animals.
You seem evenly matched.
Your chances of winning are good.
Your chances of winning are great.
Your chances of winning are poor.
Your chances of winning are awful.
Your chances of winning are very good.
Your chances of winning are very poor.
You prepare yourself for the upcoming holmgang.
Vassal opinion increases by §G+15§! for §Y12§! months.\nYou move inside the large feast hall...
You stow the chest safely away for now.
You approve the exorcism.
You pace back and forth.
You refuse the exorcism.
The bear is taken outside and shot.
You walk away disappointed.
[demon_child.GetFirstName]'s behavior concerns you sometimes.
Your men haul the woman outside and throw her into a nearby pile of refuse.
You mourn the loss of your bear companion.
You order your men to release the bear back into the wild.
You send the wretched creature away.
The hangman readies his rope.
Has not picked a patron deity for 10 years.\n
§Y[Root.GetTitledFirstName]§! gets to pick a new patron deity to worship.
